intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion tephrophilum, commonly known as the tephrophilum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It thrives in nutrient-poor, acidic soils, often found in heathlands and open woodlands. The plant has basal rosettes of serrated, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in late summer. Its inflorescence consists of a single flower per stem, which is surrounded by bracts. Hieracium tephrophilum is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
